column4: is there a list of other window managers available for ubuntu rather than just xfce, gnome, or kde ?
does lubuntu use openbox, magicianlord?
it uses openbox as the WM and LXDE as the DE
xfce4 isnt a WM, nor is gnome or kde
kde is a desktop and uses KWIN as its WM
(K) (D)esktop (E)nvironment   0 massive clue
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=764060    if you search software centre stuff will come up
you can grab the debs and use dpkg but you will need to manually satisfy deps which apt-get does for you
sudo crontab -e
add the line:   0 0 * * * shutdown -h now
the sudo crontab -e     will cron as root (needed for shutdown), the next bit I gave was to be added to the file. When you exit the editor the cron will be added
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron
its not a good idea, it removes a LOT of security in your OS
just cron as root, no need to mess with sudoers
sudo crontab -e     will do it
sudo crontab -e
or if you have a desktop UI:  gksudo gnome-schedule
